archetype_name: Family Heat Lovers: Korean & Latin American Feasts (Hot, 30–60, Advanced)
name: Spicy Gochujang Picadillo Bibimbap Bowls with Charred Corn–Bean Relish and Quick Cucumber Pickles
description: Korean bibimbap meets Latin picadillo: hot gochujang-beef over steamed rice, topped with a lime-jalapeño corn–black bean relish and crisp rice-vinegar cucumber pickles.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; drain.
Mix pickle brine: 1/3 cup rice vinegar, 1 tbsp sugar, 1/2 tsp salt; add cucumber and toss. Set aside 15–20 min.
Dice 1 onion and 1 bell pepper; mince 3 cloves garlic.
Finely chop 2 jalapenos (seed for less heat).
Rinse and drain 1 can black beans; pat dry.
Thinly slice 2 spring onion; roughly chop a handful of coriander.
Preheat an outdoor grill or a heavy skillet to high for the corn.
Gather spices and sauces: gochujang, chilli powder, ground cumin, paprika, black pepper, salt.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice, 2 1/4 cups water, and a pinch of salt to a pot. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and cook 12–15 min. Rest covered 5 min, then fluff.
Char the corn: Toss 2 cups corn with 1 tbsp canola oil and a pinch of salt. Grill in a basket or sear in a hot skillet until lightly charred, 4–6 min; transfer to a bowl.

Make the relish: Add black beans, jalapenos, juice of 1 lime, 1 tbsp olive oil (or canola oil), 1/4 tsp salt, and black pepper to the corn. Stir in half the spring onion and half the coriander. Taste and adjust lime/salt.
Cook the beef: Heat 1 tbsp canola oil in a large pan over medium-high. Add onion and bell pepper; cook until softened, 4–5 min. Add garlic; cook 30 sec.
Add 1 lb ground beef; break up and brown until no pink remains, 5–6 min. Spoon off excess fat if needed.

Season beef: Stir in 3 tbsp gochujang, 1 tsp chilli powder, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 cup water. Simmer, stirring, 2–3 min until glossy and saucy. Finish with black pepper to taste.
Quick pickle finish: Drain cucumber pickles (reserve a spoon of brine). Toss with a pinch of black pepper; add a splash of brine to brighten if desired.
Assemble bowls: Divide rice into 4 bowls. Top with spicy beef, spoon on corn–bean relish, add cucumber pickles. Garnish with remaining spring onion and coriander.
Serve hot: Offer extra gochujang at the table for more heat.
